meanings.definition: A person or thing that stimulates.
meanings.sent1: The teacher was a great stimulator of curiosity in her students.
meanings.sent2: The coffee served as a stimulator to help him stay awake during the long meeting.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy was a little stimulator of chaos in the house.
meanings.sent4: Her infectious laughter acted as a stimulator, spreading joy to everyone around.
meanings.sent5: The colorful illustrations in the book served as a stimulator, capturing the children's attention.

meanings.definition: An electrical device used to produce stimulation.
meanings.sent1: The doctor used the stimulators to help the patient's muscles relax.
meanings.sent2: The massage chair had built-in stimulators to provide a soothing massage.
meanings.sent3: The futuristic robot had tiny stimulators that helped it move with precision.
meanings.sent4: The virtual reality headset had stimulators that enhanced the gaming experience.
meanings.sent5: The electronic stimulators were used in physical therapy to aid in muscle recovery.

meanings.definition: Something that encourages or prompts action.
meanings.sent1: The promise of a reward acted as a stimulator for the students to complete their homework.
meanings.sent2: The deadline served as a stimulator for him to finish the project on time.
meanings.sent3: The smell of freshly baked cookies was a delicious stimulator for her to start baking.
meanings.sent4: The inspiring speech was a powerful stimulator for the team to work together towards their goal.
meanings.sent5: The success stories of others can be a great stimulator for individuals to pursue their dreams.
